title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 June 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Lyes> has quit  
01:22 <teekay> Hi all, I seem to have a problem where my solr search keeps indexes of deleted wikis. Any clue as to where to look? I've tried to re-index my farm but to now avail..  
01:23 <lucaa> has quit  
02:05 <teekay> deleting the solr and lucene folders in the permanent directory and letting solr re-index seems to have solved my problem..  
02:05 <teekay> found the solution from here http://xwiki.475771.n2.nabble.com/Solr-returning-quot-no-results-quot-td7586687.html  
02:06 <teekay> still not sure why solr keeps indexes of deleted wikis though, would it be a postgres problem?  
05:05 <bouquetf> has quit

09:09 <vmassol> goodm orning  
09:09 <vmassol> morning  
09:10 <vmassol> I'd like to propose a BFD today since we're 10 bugs away from our threshold, wdyt?  
09:10 <vmassol> (and since we're getting close to the final 6.1 release)  
09:10 <tmortagne> ok for me  
09:10 <Enygma`> 'morning  
09:10 <evalica> :) I've been doing BFD all week :) k for me  
09:10 <Enygma`> +1 for me :)  
09:11 <vmassol> evalica:  :)  
09:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: have you added the latest BFD on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XWikiDays  
09:11 <vmassol> (I don't think so)  
09:11 <tmortagne> probably not  
09:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: I don't think you announced the resutls  
09:12 <vmassol> (in a blog post)  
09:12 <tmortagne> yes, I'm on it  
09:12 <vmassol> k  
09:12 <vmassol> do you know the number?  
09:13 <vmassol> 59?  
09:13 <vmassol> so today would be 60?  
09:13 <tmortagne> hmm  
09:13 <vmassol> hmm  
09:14 <vmassol> that's a long time ago  
09:14 <vmassol> checking mails  
09:14 <tmortagne> looks like I announced the wrong number last time (58 again)  
09:14 <tmortagne> so there are 2 missing  
09:14 <tmortagne> and since the previous one was missing I announced it again  
09:15 <tmortagne> and as expected it's me again...  
09:15 <vmassol> :)  
09:15 <tmortagne> but I did wrote the blog post at least last time  
09:16 <vmassol> #57 on 13 March  
09:16 <vmassol> #58 on 2nd of April  
09:16 <tmortagne> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Bug+Fixing+Day+58  
09:16 <vmassol> #59 on 18th of June  
09:16 <vmassol> correct?  
09:16 <tmortagne> 3 and 19 I think  
09:16 <vmassol> sure  
09:17 <tmortagne> according to the mails  
09:17 <vmassol> so today is 60 right?  
09:17 <tmortagne> yes  
09:17 <vmassol> ok sending mail  
09:24 <tmortagne> vmassol: created  "XWiki Days" blog category  
09:24 <tmortagne> "Other" is not nice for something we are doing so often  
09:25 <vmassol> I agree  
09:25 <vmassol> are you going to recategorize all past blogs?  
09:25 <vmassol> (we probably should)  
09:27 <tmortagne> finishing with mine for now and will check the old ones

09:28 <vmassol> ok

12:46 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <vfzevaze> hi there, just upgraded to 6.0.1 from 5.4.4 and now experiencing weird permission behavior, new added users via ldap has no rights to access the main page, but can create spaces and even edit the main page…  
12:49 <vfzevaze> already tried to: having the user isolated in a own group, granting the user admin rights, CheckProgrammingRights with the admin script, reinstalling the main ui core extension, but nothing seams to help  
12:50 <vfzevaze> anyone knows how to reset the permissions? i dont mind starting all over again...  
13:01 <evalica> vfzevaze: I don't know to answer your question, but maybe you should ask this question on the mailinglist [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
13:02 <vfzevaze> ok thx  
13:08 <vfzevaze> but do you maybe know if \_a\_ &/ \_the\_ admin has to be in the global all group?  
13:09 <evalica> vfzevaze: I don't know. I haven't tested the upgrade you are mentioning and I don't usually play with rights.  
13:25 <gdelhumeau> Guys, I need your opinions on XWIKI-10561 (blocker)  
13:30 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
13:31 <Lyes> has quit  
14:22 <vfzevaze> has quit  
14:23 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <vmassol> guys what's our strategy for supporting translations for xclasses that are created in code?  
14:42 <vmassol> for ex here I'm referring to the SSX/JSX xclasses  
14:42 <vmassol> they have for example:  
14:42 <vmassol>             String useOptions = "currentPage=Always on this page|onDemand=On demand|always=Always on this wiki";  
14:42 <vmassol>             needsUpdate |= bclass.addStaticListField(USE\_FIELDNAME, "Use this extension", useOptions);  
14:43 <vmassol> I guess we would need to create programatically various documents (one per language we want to translate)  
14:43 <vmassol> taking keys from ApplicationResources\_\*.properties located at the root of the JAR  
14:43 <vmassol> have we done this before?  
14:44 <vmassol> should we try to stop creating xclasses in code and always ask them to be provided in XARs instead?  
14:47 <vmassol> actually  
14:47 <vmassol> I'm talking rubbish  
14:47 <vmassol> I just need translation properties like:  
14:47 <vmassol> XWiki.TestClass\_mylist\_1=My Value 1  
14:47 <vmassol> XWiki.TestClass\_mylist\_2=My Value 2  
15:03 <msmeria> has quit  
15:10 <vmassol> http://maven.apache.org/docs/3.2.2/release-notes.html

17:26 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
18:06 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: would be really nice to fix the annotations button before 6.1 final  
18:06 <vmassol> (it's really ugly where it is ATM ;))  
18:06 <cjd> has quit  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> wdym  
18:06 <vmassol> below the other buttons  
18:06 <gdelhumeau> there is no perfect solution  
18:06 <vmassol> ???  
18:07 <vmassol> why not put in the middle of the page  
18:07 <gdelhumeau> I can reduce the size of the cell that contains the document title  
18:07 <vmassol> ?  
18:07 <vmassol> I'm joking of course  
18:07 <gdelhumeau> in order to get the size of the cell containing buttons larger  
18:07 <vmassol> where it is now is one of the worse position  
18:07 <vmassol> so I don't understand why you say that  
18:07 <vmassol> \*worst  
18:07 <gdelhumeau> just look on a larger screen  
18:08 <vmassol> ahah fun  
18:08 <vmassol> that's not the issue  
18:08 <vmassol> (not the only issue)  
18:09 <vmassol> it just doesn't fit where it is  
18:09 <vmassol> there's no reason to have an annotation button there  
18:09 <vmassol> there's More Actions and then on its right Annotations  
18:09 <vmassol> that cannot make sense  
18:09 <vmassol> becuase More is More…  
18:09 <vmassol> you cannot have more than more :)  
18:10 <vmassol> ah better location is inside the More Actions menu  
18:10 <vmassol> s/ah/a  
18:10 <vmassol> (for example)  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> So the best would be to have annotations inside yes  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> That was ly plan  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> But it is not that easy  
18:10 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10548  
18:11 <vmassol> it's easy, what's hard is to do it in a decoupled way  
18:11 <vmassol> right now it's added  with JSX AFAIK right?  
18:11 <gdelhumeau> " But I don't know how to do it, because there is some conflicts between Prototype (annotation code) and jQuery (menu dropdowns code)."  
18:11 <gdelhumeau> I have done an attempt  
18:12 <gdelhumeau> I was able to add a new line inside "More Actions"  
18:12 <gdelhumeau> but  
18:12 <gdelhumeau> When I was clicking on it, the dropdown menu did not disappear  
18:12 <gdelhumeau> because annotations uses Prototype events handler  
18:12 <gdelhumeau> meanwhile menu dropdown uses jQuery events handler  
18:13 <gdelhumeau> or maybe I can hack this  
18:13 <vmassol> there are some other options  
18:13 <vmassol> like:  
18:14 <vmassol> make it a static menu entry while we wait for the menu extension points implementation  
18:14 <vmassol> (just check the the annotation feature is avail to display it)  
18:14 <vmassol> s/the the/that the  
18:15 <gdelhumeau> but the menu will still not disappear  
18:15 <gdelhumeau> brb  
18:15 <vmassol> there are several items in the More Actions already  
18:15 <vmassol> I assume they work fine  
18:15 <vmassol> so one more entry should also work fine  
18:16 <vmassol> no?  
18:27 <vfzevaze> has quit  
18:35 <gdelhumeau> I am gonna do a hack if you wish  
18:37 <vmassol> ATM it's doubly ugly: once because on most screens it's on row under and second because it looks strange on the right of More Actions  
18:46 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
18:57 <gdelhumeau> tadaa  
18:57 <vmassol> :)  
18:57 <vmassol> just missing a TODO annotation that explains what needs to be done to make it clean  
18:58 <gdelhumeau> BTW we have introduced a lot of changes after rc1  
18:58 <vmassol> annotation is a bad choice of word...  
18:58 <vmassol> I mean TODO comment  
18:58 <gdelhumeau> it would be logic to release a rc2?  
18:58 <mflorea> has quit  
18:58 <vmassol> yes could be  
18:58 <vmassol> who's the RM?  
18:59 <gdelhumeau> the TODO would be: switch to jQuery  
18:59 <gdelhumeau> it's a big one  
19:01 <vmassol> gtg  
19:01 <vmassol> I would put a different TODO  
19:01 <vmassol> TODO: Remove when the Menu extension points system is in place
